019package org.jgrapes.util;
020
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.HashMap;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.Optional;
027import java.util.StringTokenizer;
028import java.util.TreeMap;
029import java.util.regex.Pattern;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
031import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
032import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
033import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
034import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
035import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.HandlerDefinition.ChannelReplacements;
036import org.jgrapes.util.events.InitialConfiguration;
037
038/**
039 * A base class for configuration stores.
040 */
041@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
042public abstract class ConfigurationStore extends Component {
043
044    public static final Pattern NUMBER = Pattern.compile("^\\d+$");
045
046    /**
047     * Creates a new component with its channel set to itself.
048     */
049    public ConfigurationStore() {
050        // Nothing to do.
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Creates a new component base with its channel set to the given 
055     * channel. As a special case {@link Channel#SELF} can be
056     * passed to the constructor to make the component use itself
057     * as channel. The special value is necessary as you 
058     * obviously cannot pass an object to be constructed to its 
059     * constructor.
060     *
061     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
062     * handlers listen on by default and that 
063     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
064     */
065    public ConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel) {
066        super(componentChannel);
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Creates a new component base like {@link #ConfigurationStore(Channel)}
071     * but with channel mappings for {@link Handler} annotations.
072     *
073     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
074     * handlers listen on by default and that 
075     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
076     * @param channelReplacements the channel replacements to apply
077     * to the `channels` elements of the {@link Handler} annotations
078     */
079    public ConfigurationStore(Channel componentChannel,
080            ChannelReplacements channelReplacements) {
081        super(componentChannel, channelReplacements);
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Each value in the map passed as argument represents properties
086     * as a map of keys and (possibly) structured values (value, 
087     * collection or map). Each such map of properties is converted
088     * to a (possibly larger) map of properties where the structural
089     * information has been added to the keys.
090     *
091     * @param structured the map with structured properties
092     * @return the map with flattened properties
093     */
094    public static Map<String, String> flatten(Map<String, ?> structured) {
095        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
096        Map<String, String> result = new HashMap<>();
097        flattenObject(result, null, structured);
098        return result;
099    }
100
101    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
102    private static void flattenObject(Map<String, String> result,
103            String prefix, Object value) {
104        if (value == null) {
105            result.put(prefix, null);
106            return;
107        }
108        if (value instanceof Map) {
109            for (var entry : ((Map<String, ?>) value).entrySet()) {
110                flattenObject(result,
111                    Optional.ofNullable(prefix).map(p -> p + ".").orElse("")
112                        + entry.getKey(),
113                    entry.getValue());
114            }
115            return;
116        }
117        if (value instanceof Collection) {
118            int count = 0;
119            for (var item : (Collection<?>) value) {
120                flattenObject(result, prefix + "." + count++, item);
121            }
122            return;
123        }
124        result.put(prefix, value.toString());
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Structure the given properties by looking for patterns in the keys.
129     *
130     * @param flatProperties the flat properties
131     * @return the map
132     */
133    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
134        "PMD.ReturnEmptyCollectionRatherThanNull" })
135    public static Map<String, Object>
136            structure(Map<String, String> flatProperties) {
137        if (flatProperties == null) {
138            return null;
139        }
140        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
141        Map<Object, Object> result = new HashMap<>();
142        for (var entry : flatProperties.entrySet()) {
143            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
144            Map<Object, Object> target = result;
145            // Original key (optionally) consists of dot separated parts
146            StringTokenizer parts = new StringTokenizer(entry.getKey(), ".");
147            while (true) {
148                var part = parts.nextToken();
149                Object key = NUMBER.matcher(part).find()
150                    ? Integer.parseInt(part)
151                    : part;
152                if (!parts.hasMoreTokens()) {
153                    // Last part (of key), store value
154                    target.put(key, entry.getValue());
155                    break;
156                }
157                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
158                var newTarget = (Map<Object, Object>) target
159                    .computeIfAbsent(part, k -> new TreeMap<Object, Object>());
160                target = newTarget;
161            }
162        }
163
164        // Now convert all maps that have only Integer keys to lists
165        for (var entry : result.entrySet()) {
166            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue()));
167        }
168
169        // Return result
170        @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
171        Map<String, Object> res = (Map<String, Object>) (Map) result;
172        return res;
173    }
174
175    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "PMD.ConfusingTernary" })
176    private static Object maybeConvert(Object value) {
177        if (!(value instanceof Map)) {
178            return value;
179        }
180        List<Object> converted = new ArrayList<>();
181        for (var entry : ((Map<Object, Object>) value).entrySet()) {
182            entry.setValue(maybeConvert(entry.getValue()));
183            if (converted != null && entry.getKey() instanceof Integer) {
184                converted.add(entry.getValue());
185                continue;
186            }
187            converted = null;
188        }
189        return converted != null ? converted : value;
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Return the properties for a given path if they exists. This
194     * method should only be used in cases where configuration values
195     * are needed before the {@link InitialConfiguration} event is
196     * fired, e.g. while creating the component tree. 
197     * 
198     * @param path the path
199     * @return the values, if defined for the given path
200     */
201    public abstract Optional<Map<String, String>> values(String path);
202
203    /**
204     * Return the properties for a given path if they exists
205     * as structured data, see {@link #values(String)}. 
206     * 
207     * @param path the path
208     * @return the values, if defined for the given path
209     */
210    public Optional<Map<String, Object>> structured(String path) {
211        return values(path).map(ConfigurationStore::structure);
212    }
213
214}
